subject: Re: [junit] Re: DynaMock EasyMock JMock?
msgSnippet: ... I agree with that, mocking JDBC tends to be tedious with dynamic-mocking frameworks. I tend to stub JDBC instead or run against an in memory database but
messageBody:
> You can try to use it to mock jdbc object, but it might be heavy if
> your design is not prepared for it (You might have to write an
> important number of mock expectations).

I agree with that, mocking JDBC tends to be tedious with
dynamic-mocking frameworks. I tend to stub JDBC instead or run against
an in memory database but only from the unit-tests that test the
actual JDBC-access. I try to keep my JDBC-access classes thin whith
simple interfaces. Those interfaces can in turn be mocked with rMock,
EasyMock or rMock when testing other classes.

Hope this helps
